titleInfo.title: Can the vaccinations end the Covid-19 pandemic?

mods.abstract: In this paper we empirically analyze the effect of the vaccinations against the SARS-CoV-2 virus on the Covid-19 pandemic for European countries from February 2021 to February 2022 with weekly data. We perform panel fixed effects estimations, GMM estimations and nonlinear penalized spline estimations. We find a statistically significant and positive relation between the share of infections with the SARS-CoV-2 virus and the share of vaccinated people. That holds for both fully vaccinated persons and for people having received a booster injection as well. As regards hospitalizations we find weak empirical evidence for a negative relation between vaccinations and the rate of hospitalizations.

originInfo.publisher: Bielefeld University, Department of Business Administration and Economics
